title: Cameraman caught filming England training session ahead of semi-final vs New Zealand
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Eddie Jones claims someone was caught spying on England’s training sessions ahead of their World Cup semi-final against New Zealand this weekend.

England take on defending champions New Zealand on Saturday, with the Kiwis favourites to make it to their third successive World Cup final.

The England coach did not accuse the All Blacks of being responsible for the mystery cameraman, but confirmed there was an incident.

‘There was definitely someone in the apartment block filming, but it might have been a Japanese fan. We don’t care, mate,’ Jones said.

England take on New Zealand on Saturday (Picture: Getty)

‘We knew about it from the start, it doesn’t change anything. We love it.’

Jones, originally from Australia, is renowned for his attempts to get under the skin of the opposition before big games.

Accusations of spying is a common thread in elite sports and Jones admitted he used to secretly record rivals’ sessions.

‘I haven’t done it since 2001, used to do it. You just don’t need to do it any more, you can see everything,’ Jones said.

‘You can watch everyone’s training on YouTube.

Jones says he used to spy on other teams (Picture: Getty)

‘There’s no value in doing that sort of thing, absolutely zero.

‘Everyone knows what everyone does, there are no surprises in world rugby any more.

‘That’s the great thing about the game, you just have to be good enough on the day.’
